docs.snippet: “‘I’m Barry Altmark,’” he said. “‘I have loved you since I was 3 years old.’”

headline.print_headline: Sweethearts at Age 3, and Now Forever

docs.snippet: Restaurants in Palo Alto are increasingly struggling as rents soar and workers are hired away by the corporate cafeterias of behemoths like Google.

headline.print_headline: An Industry Cut to the Bone
headline.main: How Tech Companies Disrupted Silicon Valley’s Restaurant Scene

docs.abstract: Restaurateurs in Palo Alto, Calif, and other parts of Silicon Valley say tech bubble is disrupting food service industry and forcing many establishments to scale down or bust as result of rising rents, high local fees and acute labor shortages.

docs.snippet: The internet was supposed to democratize information, but instead it has democratized disinformation.

docs.snippet: The deadly fire in an Oakland warehouse has shed light on an illegal housing boom and prompted questions about whether the building should have been shut down.

headline.print_headline: Oakland Site Violated Codes but Filled Need
headline.main: Oakland’s ‘Ghost Ship,’ Site of Fire, Was a Motley Warehouse With a History

docs.abstract: Warehouse fire that claimed lives of at least 36 people has raised questions about whether authorities in Oakland, Calif, should have done more to shut down building, which was known by many as illegal home and performance space; Oakland officials say city takes illegal housing seriously, but there are so many informally converted spaces that building inspectors, firefighters and police are overwhelmed by problem.
